title: Ticket #4655: $(IP_ADDRESS) should [bracket] IPv6 addresses
description:
When $(IP_ADDRESS) is expanded, if the address is an IPv6 address, it should have [square brackets] around it, ie [::1].

Anywhere in our configuration file where we might want an automatically determined IP address is a place where it should have square brackets if IPv6 but not is IPv4. For example: 

COLLECTOR_HOST = $(IP_ADDRESS):0

On an IPv4 machine, COLLECTOR_HOST should look something like "192.168.0.123:0", but on an IPv6 machine it should be something like "[fe80::250:56ff:fec0:1]:0" Currently, the latter is "fe80::250:56ff:fec0:1:0" which is definitely wrong.
